question: On treating 100 mL of 0.1 M aqueous solution of the complex <katex>$CrCl_{3} \cdot 6H_{2}O$</katex> with excess of <katex>$AgNO_{3}$</katex>, 2.86 g of AgCl was obtained. The complex is:
explanation: Moles of complex = <katex>$0.1 \times 0.1 = 0.01$</katex>. Moles of AgCl = <katex>$2.86 / 143.5 = 0.02$</katex>. Since 1 mole of complex gives 2 moles of AgCl, there are 2 ionizable chloride ions outside the coordination sphere. The formula is <katex>$[Cr(H_{2}O)_{5}Cl]Cl_{2} \cdot H_{2}O$</katex>.
